alert.note: Alert for Buncombe; Burke Mountains; Eastern McDowell; Greater Burke; McDowell Mountains; Yancey (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 09 at 6:44AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of McDowell, eastern Buncombe, southeastern Yancey and southwestern Burke Counties through 715 AM EDT... At 644 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles southeast of Spruce Pine to 8 miles north of Downtown Asheville. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Marion, Morganton, Black Mountain, Swannanoa, Fairview In Buncombe County, Glen Alpine, Old Fort, B.R. Parkway-East Asheville To Craggy Gardens, B.R. Parkway-Craggy To Little Switzerland and Warren Wilson College. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Buncombe; Burke Mountains; Eastern McDowell; Greater Burke; McDowell Mountains; Yancey
